reviewText:
This is one of the very first games I'm writing a review for, and I'll tell you why.
This game has a frankly STUPID amount of potential.
-With a couple tweeks on ship speed and size (as there tends to be a gulf between ships sizes and the weapons provided) [Specifically the gulf between Frigates and Corvettes {My complaint being with the corvettes just being heavy fighters, with rotating, singular turrets}] this game would perform very very well.
--A couple things to be taken in to account (game dev, and potential players):--
-Slamming full speed into a meteor should kill you (depending on ship size, speed and shield) [It currently does not]
Speed for some of the larger ships needs to be improved, especially the maneuverability (turn speed) of the Corvette and the Frigates
-Potential option for not displaying location of enemy ships until they are in Line Of Sight (Allowing for Corvettes to possibly display locations of ships to whole team, adding a strategic advantage to them.)
-Please please, please, game developer gods, add a spectator cam.
-Add a speech box
-Allow for team speak/world speak
-Do not make someone leave the game the SECOND they die.
-More complex explosion for larger ships
-Deadly shrapnel from exploded ships (Could block weapons, provide covered approach. [Would work based on size/speed {Bottom=DroneDebris/FighterDebris/CorvetteDebris/FrigateDebris/DestroyerDebris/CapitalShipDebris=Top}])
-A tutorial, and sensible controls
-Flying into a larger ship's engines should slowly kill you.
-Port and Starboard mounted cannons that slightly swivel

Other than that, it functions great as a quick, fun game with decent ship interplay. I highly suggest you bring a group of friends into this, especially if you can get enough friends to fill a server.

For an early access, free, space combat centric game, I give it 8.2/10

reviewText:
Not sure why so many negative reviews to make this game a mixed rating, it honestly deserves a positive rating. This is a great indie game.

Codename: Rogue Fleet is a 3-D space enviorment where 2 fleets engage in a massive battle within an asteroid belt. This game is completely Free to play, and no micro transactions at all. Players choose from a lists of preset ships and use many different forms of weapons to vaporize their foes.

Pros:
Its only 500mb
Graphics are Good
Lots of different ships
Feels like an actual space combat, not sci-fi, (It's not totally realistic, but it does feel like it, and plays really well because of it.)

Cons:
Camera viewing angle.
ship speed can throw pacing off a bit at times


With the camera controls inverted, it feels really weird after playing so many games with normal view controls.

Things that aren't cons, but could make the game better:
Target tracking system(accquiring a lock won't help with missiles, but you will know the location of your enemies)
Tutorial (would be nice, but not required, literally pause the game and click options)
Team rosters (So you know how many enemies are left)
Personalization of ships (names, paint schemes, decals, all personal preferences by me, but the default models are really well done).

Overall this game is some good fun in its current state, and I feel it will only get better as time goes on. I would definitely download it and try it out!

After reading the good and bad reviews I decided to play the game for myself. All of the bad reviews say that the controls are hard or impossible to use when infact all you have to do is look in the options and chance the controls to how you want to fly but then again, some people dont like doing such things.

A way to win. I went into several games and shot up a few people but no one was dying or blowing apart so toning down the amount of heath and armor each ship has would be good so noone is spending 20 minutes trying to destroy one ship.

Add a tutorial. Victory timer or kill/point system. Victory time so that you can just destroy people for a set amount of time or kill/point system to get a set amount of kills to win each match so more people will know what the odvious point of each match is.

Communication. As of now their is no way to talk to your team or the other team so adding a text or mic relay to chat with people would be really nice.

--End Personal Thoughts--

Anyway, the game is still new so their will be some things that need to be added but it is still alot of fun to be had if you get a good amount of people per team plus the fact that their are 10 different ships to choose from so if you want to have epic space battles their will be no problem.

Lots of mixed reviews here but I think this game could be pretty good with a bit of work.
Video gameplay/review here but I've written out my thoughts below in case you don't like video:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=603796148

-not a bad looking game (homeworld 2 asthetic)
-weapons seemed to hit ships when aimed at them...again sounds obvious but a lot of games seem to have issues with this

Cons:
-Lacking a LOT of polish in menus--no music, options menu is functional but very rough
-Firing torpedos more than 1 at a time tanked the heck out of my framerate
-no feedback as to health of enemy ship (apart from are shields up or down)
-combat is very, very slow on the capital ship level.  I feel that this could be sped up by at least 2x to make things a bit more exciting (at it stands you can just sit there and shoot at eachother for 7-8 minutes before someone dies)
-couldn't get camera to zoon with mouse wheel (but movement was fine)--would be nice to have an auto camera option so you don't have to adjust it as you move (not a dealbreaker though since game is slow)

Verdict: A fun way to waste a little time and shoot spaceships.  It's free and a pretty small download so give it a try.  While it isn't perfect, it is far better than probably 80% of unity games that you see pop up on steam and is completely playable, stable, and functional.

Ever wonder what Homeworld 2 would be like if half the fleet didn't know how to fly their own ships, and the other half forgot what team they were on..?  Me neither!  But if you want to know what that's like, play Rogue Fleet!

Laser corvettes seem useless against anything not a corvette, they can't even tickle a frigate.  Intercepters seem to do more damage to capital ships then bombers?  Torpedoes are almost useless considering how hard it is to aim them and how easy they are to dodge. (its satisfying when you line up a perfect shot, but they seem to do little damage anyway)  No way to communicate with fleetmates...  And for God's sake, add an alert when you attack your own team... or make it more obvious when a player is on the red team...  Half the time I am on the red team I will have teammates attacking me...

despite it's flaws I absolutely love this game.  Nothing like flying an ion frigate under the guns of a battleship and taking it out, or intuiting with a teammate the perfect ambush.  This is a fun game, great concept well executed, but obviously still needs work.  Also recommend having ten fingers on your left hand to operate the controls.

Uh... how do I rate this game?

Usually we use WASD like this: W makes you go forwards, S for backwards, while A & D goes for turning around. But this regular DOES NOT apply to this game, W makes your ship go upwards and S is for downwards! Q&E rolls your ship, which is the only reasonable mapping.

Also, there's no lock-on, range indicator or guided weapon whatsoever - of course the missiles and torpedoes will travel toward the place you're aiming, but that's all, they won't seek your target.

Further more, there's no HP bar for yourself or your enemy. That really bothers me a lot, because I don't even know if I'm doing damage to my opponents.

Fortunately this game is completely free.
